member.name: T:System.Configuration.DictionarySectionHandler
member.summary:
Simple dictionary config factory config is a dictionary mapping key->value
<add key="name" value="text"> sets key=text <remove key="name"> removes the definition of key <clear> removes all definitions

member.name: M:System.Configuration.DictionarySectionHandler.Create(System.Object,System.Object,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Given a partially composed config object (possibly null) and some input from the config system, return a further partially composed config object

member.name: P:System.Configuration.DictionarySectionHandler.KeyAttributeName
member.summary: Make the name of the key attribute configurable by derived classes.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.DictionarySectionHandler.ValueAttributeName
member.summary: Make the name of the value attribute configurable by derived classes.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.Internal.DummyDisposable
member.summary: Used to satisfy legacy interfaces.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.Internal.WriteFileContext.ReplaceFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replace one file with another, retrying if locked.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.IPersistComponentSettings
member.summary: Components should implement this interface if they want to persist custom settings in a hosting application. This interface allows the application author to tell a control whether to persist, when to load, save etc.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.IPersistComponentSettings.SaveSettings
member.summary: Indicates to the implementor that settings should be persisted.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.IPersistComponentSettings.SettingsKey
member.summary: Unique key that identifies an individual instance of a settings group(s). This key is needed to identify which instance of a component owns a given group(s) of settings. Usually, the component will frame its own key, but this property allows the hosting application to override it if necessary.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.IPersistComponentSettings.LoadComponentSettings
member.summary: Tells the component to load its settings.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.IPersistComponentSettings.SaveComponentSettings
member.summary: Tells the component to save its settings.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.IPersistComponentSettings.ResetComponentSettings
member.summary: Tells the component to reset its settings. Typically, the component can call Reset on its settings class(es).

member.name: T:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase
member.summary: Base settings class for client applications.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor without a concept of "owner" component.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IComponent)
member.summary: Constructor that takes an IComponent. The IComponent acts as the "owner" of this settings class. One of the things we do is query the component's site to see if it has a SettingsProvider service. If it does, we allow it to override the providers specified in the metadata.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Convenience overload that takes the settings key

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IComponent,System.String)
member.summary: Convenience overload that takes the owner component and settings key.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.Context
member.summary: The Context to pass on to the provider. Currently, this will just contain the settings group name.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.Properties
member.summary: The SettingsBase class queries this to get the collection of SettingsProperty objects. We reflect over the properties defined on the current object's type and use the metadata on those properties to form this collection.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.PropertyValues
member.summary: Just overriding to add attributes.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.Providers
member.summary: Provider collection

member.name: P:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.SettingsKey
member.summary: Derived classes should use this to uniquely identify separate instances of settings classes.

member.name: E:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Fires when the value of a setting is changed. (INotifyPropertyChanged implementation.)

member.name: E:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.SettingChanging
member.summary: Fires when the value of a setting is about to change. This is a cancellable event.

member.name: E:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.SettingsLoaded
member.summary: Fires when settings are retrieved from a provider. It fires once for each provider.

member.name: E:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.SettingsSaving
member.summary: Fires when Save() is called. This is a cancellable event.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.GetPreviousVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Used in conjunction with Upgrade - retrieves the previous value of a setting from the provider. Provider must implement IApplicationSettingsProvider to support this.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.OnPropertyChanged(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.PropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Fires the PropertyChanged event.

member.summary: Fires the SettingChanging event.

member.summary: Fires the SettingsLoaded event.

member.summary: Fires the SettingsSaving event.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.Reload
member.summary: Causes a reload to happen on next setting access, by clearing the cached values.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.Reset
member.summary: Calls Reset on the providers. Providers must implement IApplicationSettingsProvider to support this.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.Save
member.summary: Overridden from SettingsBase to support validation event.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Overridden from SettingsBase to support validation event.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.Upgrade
member.summary: Called when the app is upgraded so that we can instruct the providers to upgrade their settings. Providers must implement IApplicationSettingsProvider to support this.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.CreateSetting(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Creates a SettingsProperty object using the metadata on the given property and returns it.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.EnsureInitialized
member.summary: Ensures this class is initialized. Initialization involves reflecting over properties and building a list of SettingsProperty's.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.Initializer
member.summary: Returns a SettingsProperty used to initialize settings. We initialize a setting with values derived from class level attributes, if present. Otherwise, we initialize to reasonable defaults.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.GetPropertiesForProvider(System.Configuration.SettingsProvider)
member.summary: Gets all the settings properties for this provider.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.GetPropertyValue(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the value of a setting. We need this method so we can fire the SettingsLoaded event when settings are loaded from the providers.Ideally, this should be fired from SettingsBase, but unfortunately that will not happen in Whidbey. Instead, we check to see if the value has already been retrieved. If not, we fire the load event, since we expect SettingsBase to load all the settings from this setting's provider.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.IsFirstRunOfClickOnceApp
member.summary: Returns true if this is a clickonce deployed app and this is the first run of the app since deployment or last upgrade.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.IsClickOnceDeployed(System.AppDomain)
member.summary: Returns true if this is a clickonce deployed app.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.SettingsFilter(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo[])
member.summary: Only those settings class properties that have a SettingAttribute on them are treated as settings. This routine filters out other properties.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.ResetProviders
member.summary: Resets the provider collection. This needs to be called when providers change after first being set.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.ApplicationScopedSettingAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a setting is to be stored on a per-application basis.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.AppSettingsReader
member.summary: The AppSettingsReader class provides a wrapper for System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.AppSettings which provides a single method for reading values from the config file of a particular type.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.AppSettingsReader.GetValue(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the value for specified key from ConfigurationManager.AppSettings, and returns an object of the specified type containing the value from the config file. If the key isn't in the config file, or if it is not a valid value for the given type, it will throw an exception with a descriptive message so the user can make the appropriate change

member.name: M:System.Configuration.BaseConfigurationRecord.AllowExeDefinitionToEnum(System.String,System.Configuration.XmlUtil)
member.summary: Translate an ExeDefinition string from the Declaration in a file to the appropriate enumeration

member.name: M:System.Configuration.BaseConfigurationRecord.AddImplicitSections(System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary: Add implicit sections to the specified factory list.
member.param: The factory list to add to. If null, adds to the current record's factory list.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.ClientSettingsSection
member.summary: ConfigurationSection class for sections that store client settings.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.ClientSettingsStore
member.summary:
This class abstracts the details of config system away from the LocalFileSettingsProvider. It talks to the configuration API and the relevant Sections to read and write settings. It understands sections of type ClientSettingsSection.
NOTE: This API supports reading from app.exe.config and user.config, but writing only to user.config.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.ClientSettingsStore.ClientSettingsConfigurationHost
member.summary: A private configuration host that we use to write settings to config. We need this so we can enforce a quota on the size of stuff written out.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.ClientSettingsStore.ClientSettingsConfigurationHost.ClientHost
member.summary: ClientConfigurationHost implements this - a way of getting some info from it without depending too much on its internals.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ClientSettingsStore.ClientSettingsConfigurationHost.InitForConfiguration(System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.Configuration.Internal.IInternalConfigRoot,System.Object[])
member.summary: We delegate this to the ClientConfigurationHost. The only thing we need to do here is to build a configPath from the ConfigurationUserLevel we get passed in.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ClientSettingsStore.ClientSettingsConfigurationHost.OpenStreamForRead(System.String)
member.summary: If the stream we are asked for represents a config file that we know about, we ask the host to assert appropriate permissions.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ClientSettingsStore.ClientSettingsConfigurationHost.WriteCompleted(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: If this is a stream that represents a user.config file that we know about, we ask the host to assert appropriate permissions.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.StoredSetting
member.summary: The ClientSettingsStore talks to the LocalFileSettingsProvider through a dictionary which maps from setting names to StoredSetting structs. This struct contains the relevant information.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.ConfigurationCollectionAttribute
member.summary: Used on classes derived from ConfigurationElementCollection. Specifies the collection item type and verbs used for add/remove/clear.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.ConfigurationException
member.summary: A config exception can contain a filename (of a config file) and a line number (of the location in the file in which a problem was encountered). Section handlers should throw this exception (or subclasses) together with filename and line number information where possible.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.ConfigurationFileMap
member.summary: Holds the configuration file mapping for machine.config. It is the base class for ExeConfigurationFileMap and WebConfigurationFileMap.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.PreloadConfiguration(System.Configuration.Configuration)
member.summary: Recursively loads configuration section groups and sections belonging to a configuration object.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.DefaultSettingValueAttribute
member.summary: Indicates to the provider what default value to use for this setting when no stored value is found. The value should be encoded into a string and is interpreted based on the SerializeAs value for this setting. For example, if SerializeAs is Xml, the default value will be "stringified" Xml.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.DefaultSettingValueAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor takes the default value as string.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.DefaultSettingValueAttribute.Value
member.summary: Default value.

member.name: P:System.Configuration.ElementInformation.LineNumber
member.summary: The line number or 0 if no source.

member.name: F:System.Configuration.ExceptionAction.NonSpecific
member.summary: Not specific to a particular section, nor a global schema error

member.name: F:System.Configuration.ExceptionAction.Local
member.summary: Error specific to a particular section

member.name: F:System.Configuration.ExceptionAction.Global
member.summary: Error in the global (file) schema

member.name: T:System.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsProvider
member.summary: This interface is an extension to SettingsProvider that a provider can implement to support additional functionality for settings classes that derive from ApplicationSettingsBase.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsProvider.GetPreviousVersion(System.Configuration.SettingsContext,System.Configuration.SettingsProperty)
member.summary: Retrieves the previous value of a given SettingsProperty. This is used in conjunction with Upgrade.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsProvider.Reset(System.Configuration.SettingsContext)
member.summary: Resets all settings to their "default" values.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsProvider.Upgrade(System.Configuration.SettingsContext,System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyCollection)
member.summary: Indicates to the provider that the app has been upgraded. This is a chance for the provider to upgrade its stored settings as appropriate.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.IConfigurationSectionHandler
member.summary: The IConfigurationSectionHandler interface defines the contract that all configuration section handlers must implement in order to participate in the resolution of configuration settings. Composes and creates config objects. This interface is implemented by config providers. Classes implementing IConfigurationSectionHandler define the rules for cooking XML config into usable objects. The cooked objects can be of arbitrary type. Configuration is composable (e.g., config in a child directory is layered over config in a parent directory), so, IConfigurationSectionHandler is supplied with the parent config as well as any number of XML fragments.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.IConfigurationSectionHandler.Create(System.Object,System.Object,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: The function is responsible for inspecting "section", "context", and "parent", and creating a config object. Note that "parent" is guaranteed to be an object that was returned from a Create call on the same IConfigurationSectionHandler implementation. (E.g., if Create returns a Hashtable, then "parent" is always a Hashtable if it's non-null.) Returned objects must be immutable. In particular, it's important that the "parent" object being passed in is not altered: if a modification must be made, then it must be cloned before it is modified.
member.param: the object inherited from parent path
reserved, in ASP.NET used to convey virtual path of config being evaluated
the xml node rooted at the section to handle

member.name: M:System.Configuration.IgnoreSectionHandler.Create(System.Object,System.Object,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Given a partially composed config object (possibly null) and some input from the config system, return a further partially composed config object.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.ISettingsProviderService
member.summary: The IPersistComponentSettings interface enables components hosted in an application to persist their settings in a manner transparent to the application. However, in some cases, the application may want to override the provider(s) specified by a component. For example, at design time, we may want to persist settings differently. This service enables this scenario. The ApplicationSettingsBase class queries this service from the owner component's site.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.ISettingsProviderService.GetSettingsProvider(System.Configuration.SettingsProperty)
member.summary: Queries the service whether it wants to override the provider for the given SettingsProperty. If it doesn't want to, it should return null, in which the provider will remain unchanged.

member.summary: This is a provider used to store configuration settings locally for client applications.

member.summary: We maintain a single instance of the ClientSettingsStore per instance of provider.

member.summary: Abstract SettingsProvider method

member.name: M:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.Reset(System.Configuration.SettingsContext)
member.summary: Implementation of IClientSettingsProvider.Reset. Resets user scoped settings to the values in app.exe.config, does nothing for app scoped settings.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.Upgrade(System.Configuration.SettingsContext,System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyCollection)
member.summary: Implementation of IClientSettingsProvider.Upgrade. Tries to locate a previous version of the user.config file. If found, it migrates matching settings. If not, it does nothing.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.GetPreviousVersion(System.Configuration.SettingsContext,System.Configuration.SettingsProperty)
member.summary: Implementation of IClientSettingsProvider.GetPreviousVersion.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.GetPreviousConfigFileName(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Locates the previous version of user.config, if present. The previous version is determined by walking up one directory level in the *UserConfigPath and searching for the highest version number less than the current version.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.GetSectionName(System.Configuration.SettingsContext)
member.summary: Gleans information from the SettingsContext and determines the name of the config section.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.GetSettingValuesFromFile(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyCollection)
member.summary: Retrieves the values of settings from the given config file (as opposed to using the configuration for the current context)

member.name: M:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.IsRoamingSetting(System.Configuration.SettingsProperty)
member.summary: Indicates whether a setting is roaming or not.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.IsUserSetting(System.Configuration.SettingsProperty)
member.summary: This provider needs settings to be marked with either the UserScopedSettingAttribute or the ApplicationScopedSettingAttribute. This method determines whether this setting is user-scoped or not. It will throw if none or both of the attributes are present.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.Upgrade(System.Configuration.SettingsContext,System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Private version of upgrade that uses isRoaming to determine which config file to use.

member.name: T:System.Configuration.NameValueFileSectionHandler
member.summary: This section handler allows <appSettings file="user.config" /> The file pointed to by the file= attribute is read as if it is an appSettings section in the config file. Note: the user.config file must have its root element match the section referring to it. So if appSettings has a file="user.config" attribute the root element in user.config must also be named appSettings.

Use for tags of the form: <MySingleTag key1="value1" ... keyN="valueN"/>

member.name: M:System.Configuration.XmlUtil.SkipToNextElement
member.summary: Skip this element and its children, then read to next start element, or until we hit end of file.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.XmlUtil.StrictReadToNextElement(System.Configuration.ExceptionAction)
member.summary: Read to the next start element, and verify that all XML nodes read are permissible.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.XmlUtil.StrictSkipToNextElement(System.Configuration.ExceptionAction)
member.summary: Skip this element and its children, then read to next start element, or until we hit end of file. Verify that nodes that are read after the skipped element are permissible.

member.name: M:System.Configuration.XmlUtil.StrictSkipToOurParentsEndElement(System.Configuration.ExceptionAction)
member.summary: Skip until we hit the end element for our parent, and verify that nodes at the parent level are permissible.

member.summary: Add an error if the node type is not permitted by the configuration schema.

member.summary: Add an error if there are attributes that have not been examined, and are therefore unrecognized.

member.summary: Add an error if the retrieved attribute is null, and therefore not present.

member.summary: Verify and Retrieve the Boolean Attribute. If it is not a valid value then log an error and set the value to a given default.
